title: Canadian police say 10 dead in British Columbia’s Tumbler Ridge shooting
byline: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said that 10 people, including the suspected shooter, have been killed in a shooting at a high school in the province of British Columbia, with more people injured.

title: Japan observes National Foundation Day today
byline: Japan today marks its National Foundation Commemoration Day, known as Kenkoku-Kinen-no-Hi, which is observed annually today (11) to commemorate the legendary foundation of the nation and the enthronement of its first Emperor, Jimmu, in 660 BC.

title: Hemantha called up as Hasaranga ruled out of T20 World Cup
byline: The 30-year-old leg-spinner Dushan Hemantha has been handed a golden opportunity to shine on the world stage, stepping in for star all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga as Sri Lanka chase a Super Eight berth in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026.

title: After India, Sri Lanka seeks assistance from China for post-cyclone rebuilding
byline: In addition to financial assistance already secured from India, the government is now in talks with China for grants to be used in post-Ditwah rebuilding works, an official said.

title: We were cheated in the name of cultural tourism - Vedda Chief
byline: Vedda Chief Uruwarigelage Vannila Aththo has raised serious concerns over what he describes as the exploitation of his community and their age-old traditions for commercial gain, alleging that certain groups are misusing indigenous culture under the guise of promoting tourism.

title: Sri Lanka to establish first monkey detention centre in Matale
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation (DWC) has identified a site near the Kaluganga Reservoir in the Matale District for the construction of Sri Lanka’s first-ever monkey detention centre.

title: Dad shot daughter after ’arguing about Donald Trump’
byline: A British woman who was shot dead by her father while visiting his home in Texas had argued with him about US President Donald Trump earlier that day, an inquest has heard.

title: Police issue urgent guidelines amid surge in lost and stolen mobile phones in 2024–2025
byline: In response to a significant increase in complaints regarding lost and stolen mobile devices, the Sri Lanka Police has issued a comprehensive set of directives to the public.

title: Farmers’ organization alleges plan to hand over economic centres to JVP-linked company
byline: The Dambulla National Farmers’ Organization yesterday alleged that the government is planning to transfer the management of the country’s economic centres to a company comprising members affiliated with the JVP.

title: Standing for Sinhala Buddhism is not racism: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa said that defending Buddha Dhamma, Buddha Sasana, and the Maha Sangha is not an act of racism.

title: Pilot’s ‘calm decision-making’ praised as plane with 55 on board crash-lands into sea
byline: A passenger plane in Somalia carrying 55 people on board crash-landed in shallow water on a seashore near the international airport on Tuesday. No one was injured in the incident.

title: Probe on Rajapaksa’s hidden wealth in Uganda, Dubai ongoing: Nalinda
byline: The government is investigating into the allegations of hidden wealth in Uganda, Dubai and in some other places, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday.

title: Special security in place for India–Pakistan T20 match in Colombo
byline: A special security arrangement has been implemented for the India–Pakistan T20 cricket match scheduled to be held in Colombo on February 15, Cabinet Spokesperson and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka remains vigilant against Nipah virus amidst record tourist arrivals: Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan government yesterday assured the public that health authorities are maintaining strict vigilance at entry points to prevent the entry of the Nipah virus, following reports of outbreaks and fatalities in neighbouring India and Bangladesh.

title: MP files complaint with CIABOC against Speaker
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harshana Rajakaruna lodged a complaint today against Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for the alleged disruption of another complaint filed against him by the Deputy Secretary General of Parliament Chaminda Kularatne.

title: Are fans paying Rs. 100,000 on the black market?
byline: Tickets for the much-anticipated India–Pakistan encounter at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 which is scheduled to be played on Sunday, February 15, are being traded at prices as high as LKR 100,000 (approximately INR 28,000), the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Canadian police say 10 dead in British Columbia’s Tumbler Ridge shooting
byline: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said that 10 people, including the suspected shooter, have been killed in a shooting at a high school in the province of British Columbia, with more people injured.

title: Kurunegala Youth CC lift Major Club Three-Day Plate trophy
byline: Kurunegala Youth Cricket Club, led by Captain Sameera Sandamal, won the Major Club Three-Day Plate Championship organised by Sri Lanka Cricket, completing an impressive comeback in the tournament.

title: Two arrested over Rs. 6.1 million online scam
byline: The North Western Provincial Unit of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) arrested two suspects over an online business scam in which a woman was defrauded of more than Rs. 6 million.

title: All flights grounded for 10 days at US airport over security fears
byline: An airport in Texas has now grounded all flights for ten days following a national security threat.

title: 900 child cancer patients reported nationwide within a year
byline: A total of 900 child cancer patients have been reported across the country within a one-year period, according to the Health Promotion Bureau.

title: Winds reduce rains and temperature: Meteorology Department
byline: Increased winds have reduced rains bringing a dry spell to Sri Lanka, an official from the Department of Meteorology said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka sees slow growth in AI use
byline: Sri Lanka is gradually adopting artificial intelligence (AI), but the country remains behind many others in the world. According to the Microsoft AI Economy Institute, the share of Sri Lankans using generative AI tools rose slightly from 6.2% in early 2025 to 6.6% by the end of the year. The findings were published in the report titled “Global AI Adoption in 2025.”

title: Sri Lanka climbs 14 places in global corruption rankings
byline: Sri Lanka has made significant strides in global perceptions of public sector integrity, moving up 14 places in the 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) released yesterday (10) by Transparency International.

title: Twelve sentenced to death over killing of Amarakeerthi Athukorala
byline: Twelve individuals were today sentenced to death over the murder of former Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Amarakeerthi Athukorala and his security officer during the ‘Aragalaya’ period in Nittambuwa.

title: Equities close in the green on narrow gains
byline: The Colombo stock market closed today’s session with marginal gains, as both indices moved sideways within a narrow 80-point intraday range, reflecting mild volatility and a lack of clear directional momentum. Overall turnover and volume remained below average levels, while the absence of notable block trades signaled a cautious, wait-and-see stance among value investors amid the ongoing December quarter earnings season.

title: Fake SriLankan Airlines offer circulating on social media
byline: SriLankan Airlines has issued a scam alert warning the public about a fake message circulating on WhatsApp and Facebook that falsely uses the airline’s name, logo and seemingly credible brand images.

title: Significant rise in water-related accidents: Police
byline: Police said water-related accidents have gone up significantly across the country where 595 died in 2024, 388 individuals in 2025 and 24 individuals so far in 2026 have died due to water-related accidents.

title: Government never borrowed a cent for post-Ditwah rebuilding: President
byline: The government had built a strong economy to face Cyclone Ditwah, where not even a cent was borrowed or any money printed for the rebuilding efforts after Cyclone Ditwah, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Piumi Hansamali’s son, five others remanded over assault case
byline: Six suspects, including the son of actress Piumi Hansamali, who were arrested by the Welikada Police in connection with an alleged assault on a three-wheeler driver following a road accident in the Kalapaluwawa area, were ordered to be remanded till February 16 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Nuwan Kaushalya today.
